intro: Mozartia gundlachii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
